title: Authors and Citation
text: JP Monteagudo. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Monteagudo J (2024). despair: Motivational Quotes Shakespearean Bard–bits Personal Projects. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/jpmonteagudo28/despair.
code: @Manual{,   title = {despair: Motivational Quotes and Shakespearean Bard–bits for Personal Projects},   author = {JP Monteagudo},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/jpmonteagudo28/despair}, }

title: Motivational Quotes and Shakespearean Bard–bits for Personal Projects
text: despair package inspired Shakespeare’s work well-known pessimism. allows user create short, clever codes called bard–bits inspired Shakespeare’s work use daily (de)motivational quotes personal use share others.

title: Motivational Quotes and Shakespearean Bard–bits for Personal Projects
text: can install package CRAN can also install development version package devtools package.

title: Motivational Quotes and Shakespearean Bard–bits for Personal Projects
text: three basic functions package: demotivate, motivate, bard.bits. function take category input optional numeric character seed reproducible results.
code: library(despair)  #> Get info on package version   despair.message() #> despair string generated by {despair} v.0.1.0.R version 4.4.1 (2024-06-14 ucrt).  demotivate() #> "I’m not really good at advice. Can I interest you in a sarcastic comment?" demotivate("science", seed = 123) #> "No matter how hard you try, you’ll always be within one standard deviation of average." demotivate("science", seed = "lanky poodle") #> "Don't worry! There might be a socio-anthropoligical intepretation of your results"  motivate("lit") #> "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything. — Mark Twain" motivate("religion", seed = 123) #> "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us. - C.S. Lewis" motivate("religion", seed = "bewildered pooh") #> "Really great things, when discussed by little men, can usually make such men grow big. - Augustine of Hippo"  bard.bits() #> "brownish purple kite" bard.bits("character", seed = 123) #> "filthy duncan" bard.bits("character", seed = "stinky chihuahua") #> "lofty tranio"

what: Generate unique bard bits using Shakespeare's work and DSM-5 adjectives — bard.bits
title: Generate unique bard bits using Shakespeare's work and DSM-5 adjectives — bard.bits
text: bard.bits() generates bard bits using Shakespeare's works DSM-5 use personal projects. term bard–bits comes Shakespeare's title 'Bard Avon' bits ( Shakespeare's characters, places, professions) used come coherent combinations.

title: Generate unique bard bits using Shakespeare's work and DSM-5 adjectives — bard.bits
Generate unique bard bits using Shakespeare's work and DSM-5 adjectives — bard.bits
text: cat category used bard–bit. Defaults "", "character", "jobs","alliterate", "dsm_5" available. seed optional numeric character seed reproducible results.

title: Generate unique bard bits using Shakespeare's work and DSM-5 adjectives — bard.bits
text: bard.bits() takes category optional numeric character seed produce bard–bit.

title: Generate unique bard bits using Shakespeare's work and DSM-5 adjectives — bard.bits
text: category '' (default), function combines Shakespeare's adjectives, DSM-5 adjectives, colors characters, jobs, animals things data frames sample one adjective one noun two combinations. category 'alliterate', function combines adjectives colors data frames animals characters data frame. adjective selected, first letter used match noun. category 'character', function derive bard bit data frame Shakespeare's characters adjectives data frame. category 'jobs', function derive bard bit adjectives colors data frame sample one value Shakespeare's jobs data frame. category 'dsm_5', function derive bard bit combined jobs, characters, animals DSM-5 adjectives data frame.

title: Generate unique bard bits using Shakespeare's work and DSM-5 adjectives — bard.bits
text: JP Monteagudo

title: Generate unique bard bits using Shakespeare's work and DSM-5 adjectives — bard.bits
code: bard.bits("any") #> [1] "blue portia" bard.bits("dsm_5", seed = 1234) #> [1] "fragile hen" bard.bits("jobs", seed = "horrid antonio") #> [1] "savage falconer"

what: Generate demotivational quotes for personal use. — demotivate
title: Generate demotivational quotes for personal use. — demotivate
text: demotivate() tool demotivate even highly motivated individual. Use caution remember take personally.

title: Generate demotivational quotes for personal use. — demotivate
Generate demotivational quotes for personal use. — demotivate
text: cat demotivational category choose . function defaults ''. seed numeric character seed reproducible results. function defaults 'NULL'.

title: Generate demotivational quotes for personal use. — demotivate
text: demotivate() takes preferred category optional reproducible seed return demotivational quote user feel worse given time.

title: Generate demotivational quotes for personal use. — demotivate
text: cat '' (default), function combines category data frames samples new,combined data frame. total six categories: family, life, work, science, tv, rednecks. specific category chosen function sample demotivational quote data frame output random quote spiritual mental decay.

title: Generate demotivational quotes for personal use. — demotivate
text: JP Monteagudo

title: Generate demotivational quotes for personal use. — demotivate
code: demotivate("any",seed = "lanky puppy") #> [1] "Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes. - Bruce Almighty" demotivate("work") #> [1] "If you require additional affirmation, get a puppy.The rest of us are trying to work"

what: General motivation quotes for personal use — motivate
title: General motivation quotes for personal use — motivate
text: motivate() tool lift even unmotivated individual. Use caution remember— take personally.

title: General motivation quotes for personal use — motivate
General motivation quotes for personal use — motivate
text: cat motivational category choose . function defaults ''. seed numeric character seed reproducible results. function defaults 'NULL'.

title: General motivation quotes for personal use — motivate
text: motivate() takes preferred category optional reproducible seed return motivational quote user feel better given time.

title: General motivation quotes for personal use — motivate
text: cat '' (default), function combines category data frames samples new,combined data frame. total five categories: psych, stoic, religion, lit(literature), modern (history) specific category chosen function sample motivational quote data frame output random quote spiritual mental growth.

title: General motivation quotes for personal use — motivate
text: JP Monteagudo

title: General motivation quotes for personal use — motivate
code: motivate("any",seed = "lethargic raccoon") #> [1] "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes. — Mark Twain" motivate("lit") #> [1] "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great. — Mark Twain" motivate("stoic", seed = 2899) #> [1] "Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants. - Epictetus"

title: Convert any character vector to an integer for setting a reproducible seed — set.char.seed
Convert any character vector to an integer for setting a reproducible seed — set.char.seed
text: char character vector

title: Convert any character vector to an integer for setting a reproducible seed — set.char.seed
text: set.char.seed() takes character vector returns reproducible seed.

title: Convert any character vector to an integer for setting a reproducible seed — set.char.seed
text: letter number character vector assigned specific number. numbers concatenated divided 2^30 - 1, remainder division used numeric reproducible seed. get warning 'loss accuracy", consider using succinct character vector, otherwise may get seed 0.

title: Convert any character vector to an integer for setting a reproducible seed — set.char.seed
text: JP Monteagudo

title: Convert any character vector to an integer for setting a reproducible seed — set.char.seed
code: set.char.seed("The Sticky Chicken") #> [1] 258156544 set.char.seed("lanky tadpole") #> [1] 1017058471 set.char.seed("Manny said what?") #> [1] 241593498
